quote: "We all benefit from communities that are resilient" Stephen Sideroff, PhD

step_of_the_day.title:
How are you affected by the shooting of Jacob Blake? Taking responsibility for what happens in your
  community (Pillar #3)
step_of_the_day.content:
Pillar number 3 of my model of resilience is your "Relationship with something greater". This includes
  spirituality, meaning and purpose in your life. It also means an awareness and participation in your larger
  community and your commitment to creating and maintaining resilient communities. A resilient community is
  one in which people feel safe, are valued, and are treated fairly. In other words, this is the extension of
  the qualities of a resilient individual.A resilient community works for everyone in the community. Many people operate out of a "zero-sum"
  perspective. This means that if one person receives something positive, it's at the expense of someone else.
  In fact, everyone benefits from everyone else's positive experience. And this is the basis of a Resilient
  Community. Resilience results in the greatest good - for all the individuals as well as a community.

action_step:
What can you do to make a positive impact in your community, in your world? It doesn't have to be something
  big. In fact, it might just be taking a class on racism or discussing this issue with others. Being willing
  to share your perspective and learn from others. It also can mean being willing to acknowledge ways in which
  you have been prejudiced or experienced bias from someone else.
